meanings.definition: People who intimidate or threaten others.
meanings.sent1: The intimidators at school made me feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The police officer dealt with the intimidaters in a calm manner.
meanings.sent3: The group of intimidaters looked tough but were actually friendly.
meanings.sent4: The intimidaters in the movie were portrayed as villains.
meanings.sent5: The presence of intimidaters in the neighborhood made everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: Things that cause fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley was full of intimaters lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: Spiders are common intimaters for many people.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was filled with spooky intimaters.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were like looming intimaters in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder was an intimater of the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that make someone feel uncomfortable or scared.
meanings.sent1: His aggressive tone was an intimater during the argument.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loud noise acted as an intimater in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant as a harmless intimater but ended up scaring everyone.
meanings.sent4: The dark figure in the corner was an intimater of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest was an intimater of danger.
